executiveSummary: David Restiano and Dr. Dan Stats from Point Pleasant, New Jersey, pitched their company Sore Soap on Shark Tank, seeking $100,000 for 10% equity. Their product combines natural soap with a muscle-scraping therapy tool to aid recovery and relaxation. After evaluation by the Sharks, Mark Cuban offered $100,000 for 20%, which was accepted.
keyDecisions: Mark Cuban invested $100,000 in Sore Soap for 20% equity.

actionItems.task: Finalize partnership agreement with Mark Cuban
actionItems.assignee: David Restiano and Dr. Dan Stats

actionItems.task: Collaborate with Mark Cuban’s team to expand direct-to-consumer (DTC) strategy
actionItems.assignee: David Restiano and Dr. Dan Stats

actionItems.task: Continue production and retail distribution through physical therapy offices and boutique gyms
actionItems.assignee: David Restiano and Dr. Dan Stats

nextSteps: Sore Soap will proceed with Mark Cuban’s investment, leveraging his business expertise to strengthen operations and marketing, particularly in the direct-to-consumer space.
